name: pentaerythritol chloral
Reason:
- Basic unit, pentaerythritol, has a melting point of -12.5°C. 
- Chloral group (ClCOC(=O)O): adds significantly since it introduces a polar and electronegative atom, which increases intermolecular forces. An estimated effect could be around +50°C to +70°C due to the polar nature of the C-Cl bond and potential increase in molecular symmetry for the trans isomer.
